recipe_name: Petit pois à la française with tarragon and carrots
author: Richard Phillips
method: Heat the olive oil in a saucepan. Add the onion and sweat for five minutes.  Add the peas, water, stock cube and double cream, then reduce the heat and simmer gently for 3-4 minutes or until the peas are cooked.  In a small bowl, mix the butter and flour together to make a paste. Slowly add the paste to the peas a little at a time, whisking it in, until the liquid becomes thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.  Add the grated carrot and the tarragon, and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve in two soup bowls.
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil,  ¼ onion, sliced,  150g/5½oz fresh peas,  100ml/3½fl oz water,  ½ chicken or vegetable stock cube,  100ml/3½oz double cream,  55g/2oz butter, softened,  55g/2oz plain flour,  1 carrot, peeled and grated,  1 tbsp chopped fresh tarragon,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
